Introduction

Kim Hyun-joong is a South Korean singer, actor, and songwriter. He rose to fame as the leader of the boy band SS501, which debuted in 2005. He gained widespread recognition for his roles in popular television dramas such as Boys Over Flowers (2009) and Playful Kiss (2010). On June 7, 2011, Kim launched his solo career with the release of his debut mini-album, Break Down, which achieved significant commercial success, topping South Korea's Gaon Weekly Album Chart and earning platinum certification in Taiwan. The album's title track, "Break Down," secured first place on music shows including Mnet's M Countdown and KBS's Music Bank. In 2012, he expanded his solo activities to Japan with the release of his first full-length Japanese studio album, Unlimited.

Fun facts

1
Hyun Joong received two acting awards for his role in "Boys Over Flowers" -- Most Popular Actor Award at the 2009 Seoul International Drama Awards and the Most Popular Actor for Television Award at the 2009 Baeksang Arts Awards.
…
2
On July 21, 2022, Kim Hyun Joong’s agency confirmed the joyful news that he and his wife were expecting a child. Just days later, on July 29, the couple welcomed their baby boy into the world.
…
3
In a heartfelt surprise during his concert on February 27, 2022, Kim Hyun Joong delighted fans by announcing his marriage to his non-celebrity girlfriend — a moment that was later officially confirmed by his agency.
…
4
Hyun Joong will be making his small-screen comeback in the drama "When Time Stopped" (2018)
…
5
Hyun Joong is considered to be one of the biggest Hallyu stars of the early 2010s.
…
